dt: {bc}to appease by indulging to the full

pt: {sc}satiate{/sc} {sc}sate{/sc} {sc}surfeit{/sc} {sc}cloy{/sc} {sc}pall{/sc} {sc}glut{/sc} {sc}gorge{/sc} mean to fill to repletion. {sc}satiate{/sc} and {sc}sate{/sc} may sometimes imply only complete satisfaction but more often suggest repletion that has destroyed interest or desire.

pt.t: years of globe-trotting had {it}satiated{/it} their interest in travel

pt: {sc}cloy{/sc} stresses the disgust or boredom resulting from such surfeiting.

pt.t: sentimental pictures that {it}cloy{/it} after a while

pt: {sc}pall{/sc} emphasizes the loss of ability to stimulate interest or appetite.

pt.t: a life of leisure eventually begins to {it}pall{/it}

pt: {sc}glut{/sc} implies excess in feeding or supplying.
{sc}gorge{/sc} suggests glutting to the point of bursting or choking.

shortdef: to appease by indulging to the full
